name: mailchimp
description: Mailchimp is an email marketing and automation platform providing campaign templates, audience segmentation, and performance analytics to drive engagement and conversions

tools.name: MAILCHIMP_ADD_AUTOMATION
tools.description: Create a new classic automation in your Mailchimp account.

settings__reply__to.title: Settings  Reply  To
settings__reply__to.description: The reply-to email address for the Automation.

settings__from__name.title: Settings  From  Name
settings__from__name.description: The "from" name for the Automation (not an email address).

trigger__settings__workflow__type.title: Trigger  Settings  Workflow  Type
trigger__settings__workflow__type.description: The type of Automation workflow. Currently only supports "abandonedCart".

tools.name: MAILCHIMP_ADD_BATCH_WEBHOOK
tools.description: Configure a webhook that will fire whenever any batch request completes processing. You may only have a maximum of 20 batch webhooks.

url.title: Url
url.description: A valid URL for the Webhook.

enabled.title: Enabled
enabled.description: Whether the webhook receives requests or not.

tools.name: MAILCHIMP_ADD_CAMPAIGN
tools.description: Create a new Mailchimp campaign.

type.title: Type
type.description: There are four types of [campaigns](https://mailchimp.com/help/getting-started-with-campaigns/) you can create in Mailchimp. A/B Split campaigns have been deprecated and variate campaigns should be used instead.

content_type.title: Content Type
content_type.description: How the campaign"s content is put together. The old drag and drop editor uses "template" while the new editor uses "multichannel". Defaults to template.

tracking__opens.title: Tracking  Opens
tracking__opens.description: Whether to [track opens](https://mailchimp.com/help/about-open-tracking/). Defaults to `true`. Cannot be set to false for variate campaigns.

settings__to__name.title: Settings  To  Name
settings__to__name.description: The campaign"s custom "To" name. Typically the first name [audience field](https://mailchimp.com/help/getting-started-with-merge-tags/).

settings__reply__to.title: Settings  Reply  To
settings__reply__to.description: The reply-to email address for the campaign. Note: while this field is not required for campaign creation, it is required for sending.

social__card__title.title: Social  Card  Title
social__card__title.description: The title for the card. Typically the subject line of the campaign.

tracking__clicktale.title: Tracking  Clicktale
tracking__clicktale.description: The custom slug for [ClickTale](https://mailchimp.com/help/additional-tracking-options-for-campaigns/) tracking (max of 50 bytes).

rss__opts__feed__url.title: Rss  Opts  Feed  Url
rss__opts__feed__url.description: The URL for the RSS feed.

rss__opts__frequency.title: Rss  Opts  Frequency
rss__opts__frequency.description: The frequency of the RSS Campaign.

settings__folder__id.title: Settings  Folder  Id
settings__folder__id.description: If the campaign is listed in a folder, the id for that folder.

settings__from__name.title: Settings  From  Name
settings__from__name.description: The "from" name on the campaign (not an email address).

settings__auto__tweet.title: Settings  Auto  Tweet
settings__auto__tweet.description: Automatically tweet a link to the [campaign archive](https://mailchimp.com/help/about-email-campaign-archives-and-pages/) page when the campaign is sent.

settings__inline__css.title: Settings  Inline  Css
settings__inline__css.description: Automatically inline the CSS included with the campaign content.

settings__authenticate.title: Settings  Authenticate
settings__authenticate.description: Whether Mailchimp [authenticated](https://mailchimp.com/help/about-email-authentication/) the campaign. Defaults to `true`.

settings__auto__footer.title: Settings  Auto  Footer
settings__auto__footer.description: Automatically append Mailchimp"s [default footer](https://mailchimp.com/help/about-campaign-footers/) to the campaign.

settings__fb__comments.title: Settings  Fb  Comments
settings__fb__comments.description: Allows Facebook comments on the campaign (also force-enables the Campaign Archive toolbar). Defaults to `true`.

settings__template__id.title: Settings  Template  Id
settings__template__id.description: The id of the template to use.

tracking__html__clicks.title: Tracking  Html  Clicks
tracking__html__clicks.description: Whether to [track clicks](https://mailchimp.com/help/enable-and-view-click-tracking/) in the HTML version of the campaign. Defaults to `true`. Cannot be set to false for variate campaigns.

tracking__text__clicks.title: Tracking  Text  Clicks
tracking__text__clicks.description: Whether to [track clicks](https://mailchimp.com/help/enable-and-view-click-tracking/) in the plain-text version of the campaign. Defaults to `true`. Cannot be set to false for variate campaigns.

settings__preview__text.title: Settings  Preview  Text
settings__preview__text.description: The preview text for the campaign.

settings__subject__line.title: Settings  Subject  Line
settings__subject__line.description: The subject line for the campaign.

settings__auto__fb__post.title: Settings  Auto  Fb  Post
settings__auto__fb__post.description: An array of [Facebook](https://mailchimp.com/help/connect-or-disconnect-the-facebook-integration/) page ids to auto-post to.

social__card__image__url.title: Social  Card  Image  Url
social__card__image__url.description: The url for the header image for the card.

tracking__capsule__notes.title: Tracking  Capsule  Notes
tracking__capsule__notes.description: Update contact notes for a campaign based on subscriber email addresses.

rss__opts__schedule__hour.title: Rss  Opts  Schedule  Hour
rss__opts__schedule__hour.description: The hour to send the campaign in local time. Acceptable hours are 0-23. For example, "4" would be 4am in [your account"s default time zone](https://mailchimp.com/help/set-account-defaults/).

social__card__description.title: Social  Card  Description
social__card__description.description: A short summary of the campaign to display.

settings__use__conversation.title: Settings  Use  Conversation
settings__use__conversation.description: Use Mailchimp Conversation feature to manage out-of-office replies.

tracking__google__analytics.title: Tracking  Google  Analytics
tracking__google__analytics.description: The custom slug for [Google Analytics](https://mailchimp.com/help/integrate-google-analytics-with-mailchimp/) tracking (max of 50 bytes).

tracking__salesforce__notes.title: Tracking  Salesforce  Notes
tracking__salesforce__notes.description: Update contact notes for a campaign based on subscriber email addresses.

variate__settings__test__size.title: Variate  Settings  Test  Size
variate__settings__test__size.description: The percentage of recipients to send the test combinations to, must be a value between 10 and 100.

variate__settings__wait__time.title: Variate  Settings  Wait  Time
variate__settings__wait__time.description: The number of minutes to wait before choosing the winning campaign. The value of wait_time must be greater than 0 and in whole hours, specified in minutes.

rss__opts__constrain__rss__img.title: Rss  Opts  Constrain  Rss  Img
rss__opts__constrain__rss__img.description: Whether to add CSS to images in the RSS feed to constrain their width in campaigns.

tracking__salesforce__campaign.title: Tracking  Salesforce  Campaign
tracking__salesforce__campaign.description: Create a campaign in a connected Salesforce account.

variate__settings__from__names.title: Variate  Settings  From  Names
variate__settings__from__names.description: The possible from names. The number of from_names provided must match the number of reply_to_addresses. If no from_names are provided, settings.from_name will be used.

variate__settings__send__times.title: Variate  Settings  Send  Times
variate__settings__send__times.description: The possible send times to test. The times provided should be in the format YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS. If send_times are provided to test, the test_size will be set to 100% and winner_criteria will be ignored.

variate__settings__subject__lines.title: Variate  Settings  Subject  Lines
variate__settings__subject__lines.description: The possible subject lines to test. If no subject lines are provided, settings.subject_line will be used.

variate__settings__winner__criteria.title: Variate  Settings  Winner  Criteria
variate__settings__winner__criteria.description: The combination that performs the best. This may be determined automatically by click rate, open rate, or total revenue -- or you may choose manually based on the reporting data you find the most valuable. For Multivariate Campaigns testing send_time, winner_criteria is ignored. For Multivariate Campaigns with "manual" as the winner_criteria, the winner must be chosen in the Mailchimp web application.

recipients__segment__opts__conditions.title: Recipients  Segment  Opts  Conditions
recipients__segment__opts__conditions.description: Segment match conditions. There are multiple possible types, see the [condition types documentation](https://mailchimp.com/developer/marketing/docs/alternative-schemas/#segment-condition-schemas).

rss__opts__schedule__weekly__send__day.title: Rss  Opts  Schedule  Weekly  Send  Day
rss__opts__schedule__weekly__send__day.description: The day of the week to send a weekly RSS Campaign.

variate__settings__reply__to__addresses.title: Variate  Settings  Reply  To  Addresses
variate__settings__reply__to__addresses.description: The possible reply-to addresses. The number of reply_to_addresses provided must match the number of from_names. If no reply_to_addresses are provided, settings.reply_to will be used.

rss__opts__schedule__daily__send__friday.title: Rss  Opts  Schedule  Daily  Send  Friday
rss__opts__schedule__daily__send__friday.description: Sends the daily RSS Campaign on Fridays.

rss__opts__schedule__daily__send__monday.title: Rss  Opts  Schedule  Daily  Send  Monday
rss__opts__schedule__daily__send__monday.description: Sends the daily RSS Campaign on Mondays.

rss__opts__schedule__daily__send__sunday.title: Rss  Opts  Schedule  Daily  Send  Sunday
rss__opts__schedule__daily__send__sunday.description: Sends the daily RSS Campaign on Sundays.

rss__opts__schedule__monthly__send__date.title: Rss  Opts  Schedule  Monthly  Send  Date
rss__opts__schedule__monthly__send__date.description: The day of the month to send a monthly RSS Campaign. Acceptable days are 0-31, where "0" is always the last day of a month. Months with fewer than the selected number of days will not have an RSS campaign sent out that day. For example, RSS Campaigns set to send on the 30th will not go out in February.

rss__opts__schedule__daily__send__tuesda.title: Rss  Opts  Schedule  Daily  Send  Tuesday
rss__opts__schedule__daily__send__tuesda.description: Sends the daily RSS Campaign on Tuesdays.

rss__opts__schedule__daily__send__saturd.title: Rss  Opts  Schedule  Daily  Send  Saturday
rss__opts__schedule__daily__send__saturd.description: Sends the daily RSS Campaign on Saturdays.

rss__opts__schedule__daily__send__thursd.title: Rss  Opts  Schedule  Daily  Send  Thursday
rss__opts__schedule__daily__send__thursd.description: Sends the daily RSS Campaign on Thursdays.

rss__opts__schedule__daily__send__wednes.title: Rss  Opts  Schedule  Daily  Send  Wednesday
rss__opts__schedule__daily__send__wednes.description: Sends the daily RSS Campaign on Wednesdays.

recipients__segment__opts__saved__segmen.title: Recipients  Segment  Opts  Saved  Segment  Id
recipients__segment__opts__saved__segmen.description: The id for an existing saved segment.

tools.name: MAILCHIMP_ADD_CAMPAIGN_FEEDBACK
tools.description: Add feedback on a specific campaign.

block_id.title: Block Id
block_id.description: The block id for the editable block that the feedback addresses.

campaign_id.title: Campaign Id
campaign_id.description: The unique id for the campaign.

tools.name: MAILCHIMP_ADD_CAMPAIGN_FOLDER
tools.description: Create a new campaign folder.

name.title: Name
name.description: Name to associate with the folder.

tools.name: MAILCHIMP_ADD_CART
tools.description: Add a new cart to a store.

id.title: Id
id.description: A unique identifier for the cart.

lines.title: Lines
lines.description: An array of the cart"s line items.

tax_total.title: Tax Total
tax_total.description: The total tax for the cart.

campaign_id.title: Campaign Id
campaign_id.description: A string that uniquely identifies the campaign for a cart.

order_total.title: Order Total
order_total.description: The order total for the cart.

checkout_url.title: Checkout Url
checkout_url.description: The URL for the cart. This parameter is required for [Abandoned Cart](https://mailchimp.com/help/create-an-abandoned-cart-email/) automations.

customer__id.title: Customer  Id
customer__id.description: A unique identifier for the customer. Limited to 50 characters.

currency_code.title: Currency Code
currency_code.description: The three-letter ISO 4217 code for the currency that the cart uses.

customer__address__city.title: Customer  Address  City
customer__address__city.description: The city the customer is located in.

customer__opt__in__status.title: Customer  Opt  In  Status
customer__opt__in__status.description: The customer"s opt-in status. This value will never overwrite the opt-in status of a pre-existing Mailchimp list member, but will apply to list members that are added through the e-commerce API endpoints. Customers who don"t opt in to your Mailchimp list [will be added as `Transactional` members](https://mailchimp.com/developer/marketing/docs/e-commerce/#customers).

customer__address__address1.title: Customer  Address  Address1
customer__address__address1.description: The mailing address of the customer.

customer__address__address2.title: Customer  Address  Address2
customer__address__address2.description: An additional field for the customer"s mailing address.

customer__address__province.title: Customer  Address  Province
customer__address__province.description: The customer"s state name or normalized province.

customer__address__postal__code.title: Customer  Address  Postal  Code
customer__address__postal__code.description: The customer"s postal or zip code.

customer__address__country__code.title: Customer  Address  Country  Code
customer__address__country__code.description: The two-letter code for the customer"s country.

customer__address__province__code.title: Customer  Address  Province  Code
customer__address__province__code.description: The two-letter code for the customer"s province or state.

tools.name: MAILCHIMP_ADD_CART_LINE_ITEM
tools.description: Add a new line item to an existing cart.

id.title: Id
id.description: A unique identifier for the cart line item.

price.title: Price
price.description: The price of a cart line item.

quantity.title: Quantity
quantity.description: The quantity of a cart line item.

product_id.title: Product Id
product_id.description: A unique identifier for the product associated with the cart line item.

product_variant_id.title: Product Variant Id
product_variant_id.description: A unique identifier for the product variant associated with the cart line item.

tools.name: MAILCHIMP_ADD_CONNECTED_SITE
tools.description: Create a new Mailchimp connected site.

foreign_id.title: Foreign Id
foreign_id.description: The unique identifier for the site.

tools.name: MAILCHIMP_ADD_CUSTOMER
tools.description: Add a new customer to a store.

id.title: Id
id.description: A unique identifier for the customer. Limited to 50 characters.

address__city.title: Address  City
address__city.description: The city the customer is located in.

opt_in_status.title: Opt In Status
opt_in_status.description: The customer"s opt-in status. This value will never overwrite the opt-in status of a pre-existing Mailchimp list member, but will apply to list members that are added through the e-commerce API endpoints. Customers who don"t opt in to your Mailchimp list [will be added as `Transactional` members](https://mailchimp.com/developer/marketing/docs/e-commerce/#customers).

address__address1.title: Address  Address1
address__address1.description: The mailing address of the customer.

address__address2.title: Address  Address2
address__address2.description: An additional field for the customer"s mailing address.

address__province.title: Address  Province
address__province.description: The customer"s state name or normalized province.

address__postal__code.title: Address  Postal  Code
address__postal__code.description: The customer"s postal or zip code.

address__country__code.title: Address  Country  Code
address__country__code.description: The two-letter code for the customer"s country.

address__province__code.title: Address  Province  Code
address__province__code.description: The two-letter code for the customer"s province or state.

tools.name: MAILCHIMP_ADD_DOMAIN_TO_ACCOUNT
tools.description: Add a domain to the account.

verification_email.title: Verification Email
verification_email.description: The e-mail address at the domain you want to verify. This will receive a two-factor challenge to be used in the verify action.

tools.name: MAILCHIMP_ADD_EVENT
tools.description: Add an event for a list member.

name.title: Name
name.description: The name for this type of event ("purchased", "visited", etc). Must be 2-30 characters in length

list_id.title: List Id
list_id.description: The unique ID for the list.

is_syncing.title: Is Syncing
is_syncing.description: Events created with the is_syncing value set to `true` will not trigger automations.

occurred_at.title: Occurred At
occurred_at.description: The date and time the event occurred in ISO 8601 format.

subscriber_hash.title: Subscriber Hash
subscriber_hash.description: The MD5 hash of the lowercase version of the list member"s email address. This endpoint also accepts a list member"s email address or contact_id.

tools.name: MAILCHIMP_ADD_EXPORT
tools.description: Create a new account export in your Mailchimp account.

include_stages.title: Include Stages
include_stages.description: The stages of an account export to include.

since_timestamp.title: Since Timestamp
since_timestamp.description: An ISO 8601 date that will limit the export to only records created after a given time. For instance, the reports stage will contain any campaign sent after the given timestamp. Audiences, however, are excluded from this limit.

tools.name: MAILCHIMP_ADD_FILE
tools.description: Upload a new image or file to the File Manager.

file_data.title: File Data
file_data.description: The base64-encoded contents of the file.

tools.name: MAILCHIMP_ADD_FOLDER
tools.description: Create a new folder in the File Manager.

tools.name: MAILCHIMP_ADD_INTEREST_CATEGORY
tools.description: Create a new interest category.

type.title: Type
type.description: Determines how this category’s interests appear on signup forms.

title.title: Title
title.description: The text description of this category. This field appears on signup forms and is often phrased as a question.

list_id.title: List Id
list_id.description: The unique ID for the list.

display_order.title: Display Order
display_order.description: The order that the categories are displayed in the list. Lower numbers display first.

tools.name: MAILCHIMP_ADD_INTEREST_IN_CATEGORY
tools.description: Create a new interest or 'group name' for a specific category.

name.title: Name
name.description: The name of the interest. This can be shown publicly on a subscription form.

list_id.title: List Id
list_id.description: The unique ID for the list.

interest_category_id.title: Interest Category Id
interest_category_id.description: The unique ID for the interest category.

tools.name: MAILCHIMP_ADD_LANDING_PAGE
tools.description: Create a new Mailchimp landing page.

name.title: Name
name.description: The name of this landing page.

type.title: Type
type.description: The type of template the landing page has.

title.title: Title
title.description: The title of this landing page seen in the browser"s title bar.

list_id.title: List Id
list_id.description: The list"s ID associated with this landing page.

store_id.title: Store Id
store_id.description: The ID of the store associated with this landing page.

description.title: Description
description.description: The description of this landing page.

template_id.title: Template Id
template_id.description: The template_id of this landing page.

use_default_list.title: Use Default List
use_default_list.description: Will create the Landing Page using the account"s Default List instead of requiring a list_id.

tracking__track__with__mailchimp.title: Tracking  Track  With  Mailchimp
tracking__track__with__mailchimp.description: Use cookies to track unique visitors and calculate overall conversion rate. Learn more [here](https://mailchimp.com/help/use-track-mailchimp/).

tracking__enable__restricted__data__proc.title: Tracking  Enable  Restricted  Data  Processing
tracking__enable__restricted__data__proc.description: Google offers restricted data processing in connection with the California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA) to restrict how Google uses certain identifiers and other data processed in the provision of its services. You can learn more about Google"s restricted data processing within Google Ads [here](https://privacy.google.com/businesses/rdp/).

tools.name: MAILCHIMP_ADD_LIST
tools.description: Create a new list in your Mailchimp account.

contact__zip.title: Contact  Zip
contact__zip.description: The postal or zip code for the list contact.

double_optin.title: Double Optin
double_optin.description: Whether or not to require the subscriber to confirm subscription via email.

contact__city.title: Contact  City
contact__city.description: The city for the list contact.

contact__phone.title: Contact  Phone
contact__phone.description: The phone number for the list contact.

contact__state.title: Contact  State
contact__state.description: The state for the list contact.

use_archive_bar.title: Use Archive Bar
use_archive_bar.description: Whether campaigns for this list use the [Archive Bar](https://mailchimp.com/help/about-email-campaign-archives-and-pages/) in archives by default.

contact__company.title: Contact  Company
contact__company.description: The company name for the list.

contact__country.title: Contact  Country
contact__country.description: A two-character ISO3166 country code. Defaults to US if invalid.

contact__address1.title: Contact  Address1
contact__address1.description: The street address for the list contact.

contact__address2.title: Contact  Address2
contact__address2.description: The street address for the list contact.

email_type_option.title: Email Type Option
email_type_option.description: Whether the list supports [multiple formats for emails](https://mailchimp.com/help/change-audience-name-defaults/). When set to `true`, subscribers can choose whether they want to receive HTML or plain-text emails. When set to `false`, subscribers will receive HTML emails, with a plain-text alternative backup.

notify_on_subscribe.title: Notify On Subscribe
notify_on_subscribe.description: The email address to send [subscribe notifications](https://mailchimp.com/help/change-subscribe-and-unsubscribe-notifications/) to.

marketing_permissions.title: Marketing Permissions
marketing_permissions.description: Whether or not the list has marketing permissions (eg. GDPR) enabled.

notify_on_unsubscribe.title: Notify On Unsubscribe
notify_on_unsubscribe.description: The email address to send [unsubscribe notifications](https://mailchimp.com/help/change-subscribe-and-unsubscribe-notifications/) to.

campaign__defaults__subject.title: Campaign  Defaults  Subject
campaign__defaults__subject.description: The default subject line for campaigns sent to this list.

campaign__defaults__language.title: Campaign  Defaults  Language
campaign__defaults__language.description: The default language for this lists"s forms.

campaign__defaults__from__name.title: Campaign  Defaults  From  Name
campaign__defaults__from__name.description: The default from name for campaigns sent to this list.

campaign__defaults__from__email.title: Campaign  Defaults  From  Email
campaign__defaults__from__email.description: The default from email for campaigns sent to this list.

tools.name: MAILCHIMP_ADD_MEMBER_NOTE
tools.description: Add a new note for a specific subscriber.

note.title: Note
note.description: The content of the note. Note length is limited to 1,000 characters.

list_id.title: List Id
list_id.description: The unique ID for the list.

subscriber_hash.title: Subscriber Hash
subscriber_hash.description: The MD5 hash of the lowercase version of the list member"s email address.

tools.name: MAILCHIMP_ADD_MEMBER_TO_LIST
tools.description: Add a new member to the list.

tags.title: Tags
tags.description: The tags that are associated with a member.

ip_opt.title: Ip Opt
ip_opt.description: The IP address the subscriber used to confirm their opt-in status.

list_id.title: List Id
list_id.description: The unique ID for the list.

interests.title: Interests
interests.description: The key of this object"s properties is the ID of the interest in question.

ip_signup.title: Ip Signup
ip_signup.description: IP address the subscriber signed up from.

email_type.title: Email Type
email_type.description: Type of email this member asked to get ("html" or "text").

merge_fields.title: Merge Fields
merge_fields.description: A dictionary of merge fields where the keys are the merge tags. See the [Merge Fields documentation](https://mailchimp.com/developer/marketing/docs/merge-fields/#structure) for more about the structure.

timestamp_opt.title: Timestamp Opt
timestamp_opt.description: The date and time the subscriber confirmed their opt-in status in ISO 8601 format.

timestamp_signup.title: Timestamp Signup
timestamp_signup.description: The date and time the subscriber signed up for the list in ISO 8601 format.

marketing_permissions.title: Marketing Permissions
marketing_permissions.description: The marketing permissions for the subscriber.

skip_merge_validation.title: Skip Merge Validation
skip_merge_validation.description: If skip_merge_validation is true, member data will be accepted without merge field values, even if the merge field is usually required. This defaults to false.

tools.name: MAILCHIMP_ADD_MEMBER_TO_SEGMENT
tools.description: Add a member to a static segment.

list_id.title: List Id
list_id.description: The unique ID for the list.

segment_id.title: Segment Id
segment_id.description: The unique id for the segment.

tools.name: MAILCHIMP_ADD_MERGE_FIELD
tools.description: Add a new merge field for a specific audience.

tag.title: Tag
tag.description: The merge tag used for Mailchimp campaigns and [adding contact information](https://mailchimp.com/developer/marketing/docs/merge-fields/#add-merge-data-to-contacts).

name.title: Name
name.description: The name of the merge field (audience field).

public.title: Public
public.description: Whether the merge field is displayed on the signup form.

list_id.title: List Id
list_id.description: The unique ID for the list.

required.title: Required
required.description: Whether the merge field is required to import a contact.

help_text.title: Help Text
help_text.description: Extra text to help the subscriber fill out the form.

default_value.title: Default Value
default_value.description: The default value for the merge field if `null`.

display_order.title: Display Order
display_order.description: The order that the merge field displays on the list signup form.

options__size.title: Options  Size
options__size.description: In a text field, the default length of the text field.

options__choices.title: Options  Choices
options__choices.description: In a radio or dropdown non-group field, the available options for contacts to pick from.

options__date__format.title: Options  Date  Format
options__date__format.description: In a date or birthday field, the format of the date.

options__phone__format.title: Options  Phone  Format
options__phone__format.description: In a phone field, the phone number type: US or International.

options__default__country.title: Options  Default  Country
options__default__country.description: In an address field, the default country code if none supplied.

tools.name: MAILCHIMP_ADD_ORDER
tools.description: Add a new order to a store.

id.title: Id
id.description: A unique identifier for the order.

lines.title: Lines
lines.description: An array of the order"s line items.

promos.title: Promos
promos.description: The promo codes applied on the order

tax_total.title: Tax Total
tax_total.description: The tax total for the order.

campaign_id.title: Campaign Id
campaign_id.description: A string that uniquely identifies the campaign for an order.

customer__id.title: Customer  Id
customer__id.description: A unique identifier for the customer. Limited to 50 characters.

landing_site.title: Landing Site
landing_site.description: The URL for the page where the buyer landed when entering the shop.

outreach__id.title: Outreach  Id
outreach__id.description: A unique identifier for the outreach. Can be an email campaign ID.

tracking_url.title: Tracking Url
tracking_url.description: The tracking URL associated with the order.

currency_code.title: Currency Code
currency_code.description: The three-letter ISO 4217 code for the currency that the store accepts.

tracking_code.title: Tracking Code

since_created_at.description: Restrict results to segments created after the set time. Uses ISO 8601 time format: 2015-10-21T15:41:36+00:00.

since_updated_at.title: Since Updated At
since_updated_at.description: Restrict results to segments update after the set time. Uses ISO 8601 time format: 2015-10-21T15:41:36+00:00.

before_created_at.title: Before Created At
before_created_at.description: Restrict results to segments created before the set time. Uses ISO 8601 time format: 2015-10-21T15:41:36+00:00.

before_updated_at.title: Before Updated At
before_updated_at.description: Restrict results to segments update before the set time. Uses ISO 8601 time format: 2015-10-21T15:41:36+00:00.
